entry.title: The Four Musketeers
entry.content: 🎥 The Four Musketeers, 1974 ⭐️ ★★★½ The cast is still perfectly in tune, and while the sword fights remain a bit scrappy, they carry that same Lester flair . What’s less inspired but more obvious in this second opus is Michel Legrand’s score, probably one of his laziest efforts, sadly . Still, it’s thoroughly engaging, even decades later, and it’s no surprise it became a Boxing Day TV staple: entertaining, relaxing, and easy to follow without losing its bite . 🔗 https://letterboxd.com/julienpierre/film/the-four-musketeers/ #FilmReview
